info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 28 at 10:48AM EST until January 29 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 5 inches at higher elevations. 2 to 3 inches of wet heavy snow for valley locations. * WHERE...In New York, Chenango, Tioga and Broome counties. In Pennsylvania, Bradford, Susquehanna and Wyoming counties. * WHEN...Until 4 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall will be elevation dependent with elevations above 1500 feet seeing the higher accumulations. Given the heavy and wet snow, there is the potential for isolated power outages. Elevations below 1500 feet will see lower end snow accumulations with temperatures above freezing.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorist to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadways, and traffic conditions.
